title: No more RKP4
content:
I decided not to spend anytime on RKP4 because of several reasons:
even though I do have a lot of spare time now because of the holidays there the last couple of weeks were timeconsuming for my study so I did not do much in the last couple of months.
The project does not give me enough challenge as I have spent a lot of time on 2D platformers because of RKP1,2 and 3, so some ideas are recycled and only a few ideas which I could not do before could have added some challenge.
I moved over to a new project I'm working on (in silence to avoid "cease and desist" letters). A 3D cartoon racer starring famous videogame characters la "Mario Kart meets Super Smash Bros". It does give me the challenge I want and I do like 3D modelling after learning the basics. Commander Keen is a playable character and I added the neural stunner as weapon(might add Dopefish in as weapon as well), but other than a Shadowlands track there's no Commander Keen equivalences.
[img]http://www.liacs.nl/~pjordaan/in_keen.png[/img]
Commander Keen as he looks right now in the game(could be improved as I did this after a week of modeling knowledge)

The last reason is the main reason as it offers me some new challenges: besides Commander Keen driving in the BWB you can play as Duke Nukem in a Dodge Viper, Aiai from Super Monkey Ball in a Ball, Cosmo in an UFO, Mario in a kart, Sonic by foot Amazing Paperboy on a bicycle and several others. all driving their own vehicles. Their weapons consists of pacman, concrete donkeys, red shells, banana peels, neural stunner bullets and exploding sheep and many other weapons. And the tracks are also from all sorts of videogames.
[img]http://www.liacs.nl/~pjordaan/in_mario.png[/img]If Dopefish is for real, what would it be evolved from?

title: Re: No more RKP4
content: It's a shame that one of the best fangames ever is being discontinued, although your new game sounds really cool and I look forward to it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] [img]http://www.geocities.com/miniopolis/soul.txt[/img]

title: Re: No more RKP4
content:
Nice to see you again, therealdopefish.

Those screen shots are pleasing to my eyes. This game sounds quite intriguing. I'm looking forward to playing it. Keep us updated if you can!

Sorry to hear about RKP4, too, I enjoyed playing the other RKP games.[url=http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/][img]http://spikenexus.toxicsheep.com/pccw/imgs/links/pccwsml.gif[/img][/url]

title: Re: No more RKP4
content:
Oh well I was hoping to play RKP4. Any chance you'll release what you have done so far so the rest of us can see? And I like your current game so far. Are you planning on having other video game characters from the worlds you already used like possibly using Tails, Yoshi, or even Mortimer?The end is near. An evil force returns. And only Commander Keen can stop him, but this time he must team up with a super sonic hedgehog and a two tailed fox. Follow the adventure:[url=http://www.geocities.com/superadammario/chaos.html]Dimension Chaos[/url]

title: Re: No more RKP4
content:
How funny, I just noticed some code in my karting game was decreasing the framerate significantly increasing the framerate from 20-30fps to 40-70fps even with 8 karts on the screen[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img] If only I have learned the power of hardware acceleration before, it would have given me a lot of power for RKP.
I was not planning on using secondary characters as playable characters like Yoshi, Tails and Mortimer, but they might make appearances on the tracks somehow. Yoshi might be funny to add as a power-up that eats cars and turns them into eggs. Tails might be the "Lakitu" in the game.

As for a new RKP, this karting game is my first experience in 3D, so a good lesson on how to make 3D games. May be after that I might work on a 3D Commander Keen, but that'll take ages before I even start working on such project.

Some screenshots(with the first track being the paperboy track)
